item.title: 厄瓜多尔与智利子公司 ENAP 重新谈判石油协议
item.description: 厄瓜多尔能源部周六在基多表示，厄瓜多尔与智利国有石油公司ENAP的一家子公司就厄瓜多尔亚马逊地区一个石油区块的现有开采协议进行了重新谈判，到2035年将追加投资9000万美元。【原文：Ecuador and a subsidiary of Chile's state-owned oil company ENAP renegotiated an existing agreement for the exploitation of an oil block in the Ecuadorian Amazon, with an additional investment of $90 million until 2035, the Ministry of Energy in Quito said on Saturday.】

item.title: 美国联邦航空局调查西南航空公司存在安全问题的最新航班
item.description: 美国联邦航空管理局（FAA）周六表示，正在调查西南航空公司一架航班在佛罗里达州坦帕湾上空超低空飞行的事件。【原文：The Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) said Saturday it is investigating a Southwest Airlines flight after it flew at a very low altitude over Tampa Bay, Florida, the most recent in a series of incidents raising safety questions.】

item.title: 微软称约 850 万台设备受 CrowdStrike 相关故障影响
item.description: 微软公司周六在博客中表示，与网络安全公司 CrowdStrike 的软件更新有关的全球技术故障影响了近 850 万台微软设备。【原文：A global tech outage that was related to a software update by cybersecurity firm CrowdStrike affected nearly 8.5 million Microsoft devices, Microsoft said in a blog on Saturday.】

item.title: 美国在软件升级延迟后恢复接收F-35战机
item.description: 美国高级官员周六表示，在因软件延迟而停止数月后，美国已恢复交付带有临时升级功能的F-35喷气式战斗机，并将扣留部分付款，直到剩余的增强功能准备就绪。【原文：The United States has resumed taking delivery of F-35 jets with an interim upgrade after a months-long halt due to software delays, and will withhold some payments until remaining enhancements are ready, senior officials said on Saturday.】

item.title: 美国空军与波音公司就 E-7 达成 "经济实惠 "的协议
item.description: 美国空军高级官员周六表示，美国空军已与波音公司就供应 E-7 "楔尾 "机载预警和控制飞机达成了一项 "经济实惠 "的协议。【原文：The United States Air Force has reached an "affordable" deal with Boeing for the supply of E-7 Wedgetail airborne warning and control aircraft, senior officials said on Saturday.】

item.title: 波音预计 787 供应商将在年底前迎头赶上，恢复产量
item.description: 美国飞机制造商波音公司正努力在今年年底前恢复两个关键商业项目的产量，因此波音公司希望延迟交货的供应商能赶上零件的生产，这已使其787喷气式飞机的生产速度降至每月五架以下。【原文：Boeing expects delayed suppliers to catch up on parts that have slowed production of its 787 jets to below a rate of five a month, as the U.S. planemaker works to restore output of two key commercial programs by the year's end.】

item.title: 据共同社报道，新日铁聘请迈克-蓬佩奥就美国钢铁交易提供建议
item.description: 据共同社周六报道，新日本制铁公司已聘请美国前国务卿迈克-蓬佩奥（Mike Pompeo）担任其收购美国钢铁公司的顾问。【原文：Nippon Steel Corp. has hired former U.S. Secretary of State Mike Pompeo as an adviser on its efforts to acquire US Steel, Kyodo news agency reported on Saturday.】

item.title: 文件显示，伯克希尔出售约 14.8 亿美元的美国银行股票
item.description: 一份监管文件显示，伯克希尔-哈撒韦公司本周通过多次交易出售了约 3390 万股美国银行股票，总价约为 14.8 亿美元。【原文：Berkshire Hathaway sold about 33.9 million shares of Bank of America for around $1.48 billion over multiple transactions this week, a regulatory filing showed.】

item.title: 独家报道美日爱国者导弹生产计划遭遇波音组件障碍
item.description: 四名消息人士称，由于波音公司生产的一个关键部件短缺，美国利用日本工厂提高爱国者防空导弹（乌克兰用于抵御俄罗斯袭击）产量的计划被推迟。【原文：A U.S. plan to use Japanese factories to boost production of Patriot air defence missiles - used by Ukraine to defend against Russian attacks - is being delayed by a shortage of a critical component manufactured by Boeing, four sources said.】

item.title: 专家称，导致全球网络中断的 CrowdStrike 更新可能跳过了检查
item.description: 安全专家称，CrowdStrike 对其广泛使用的网络安全软件进行例行更新时，显然没有经过充分的质量检查，导致周五全球客户的计算机系统崩溃。【原文：Security experts said CrowdStrike's routine update of its widely used cybersecurity software, which caused clients' computer systems to crash globally on Friday, apparently did not undergo adequate quality checks before it was deployed.】

item.title: 波音公司预计未来 20 年全球飞机交付量将增长 3
item.description: 美国飞机制造商波音公司将其全行业 20 年新喷气式客机年交付量预测上调了 3%，达到 43975 架，原因是客运需求强劲、航空公司竞争加剧以及最终将替换效率较低的老旧飞机。【原文：U.S. planemaker Boeing raised its industry-wide annual 20-year forecast for new jetliner deliveries by 3% to 43,975, propelled by the strength of passenger demand, rising airline competition and the eventual replacement older less efficient planes.】

item.title: Binance.US 获联邦法官批准将客户资产投资于国库券
item.description: 加密货币交易所 Binance 的美国子公司周五获得联邦法官批准，将部分客户资产投资于美国国债。【原文：Cryptocurrency exchange Binance's U.S. affiliate on Friday received approval from a federal judge to invest certain customer assets in U.S. Treasury bills.】

item.title: 元内容审核供应商受全球网络中断影响
item.description: Meta 发言人在回答路透社的询问时说，一些负责管理 Facebook 所有者 Meta 平台上内容的外部供应商受到了周五全球技术故障的影响，机场、银行和医院都陷入瘫痪。【原文：Some external vendors that police content on Facebook owner Meta's platforms were affected by the global tech outage that crippled airports, banks and hospitals on Friday, a Meta spokesperson said in response to a Reuters query.】

item.title: 摩根大通称大部分自动取款机在故障中正常运行
item.description: 摩根大通（JPMorgan Chase）周五通过电子邮件发表声明称，该公司正在努力恢复受全球数字故障影响的自动取款机（ATM）的服务，同时大部分自动取款机正在正常运行。【原文：JPMorgan Chase said it is working to restore service to automated teller machines (ATMs) affected by a global digital outage while a majority of its ATMs are operating normally, according to an emailed statement on Friday.】

item.title: 美国劳工委员会放弃恢复关于合同工和特许经营工人的规定的申请
item.description: 美国全国劳资关系委员会周五放弃了对法官裁决的上诉，该裁决否决了将许多公司视为某些合同工和特许经营工人的雇主并要求他们与代表这些工人的工会进行谈判的规定。【原文：The U.S. National Labor Relations Board on Friday dropped its appeal of a judge's ruling striking down a rule that would have treated many companies as employers of certain contract and franchise workers and require them to bargain with unions representing them.】

item.title: 甲骨文公司首席执行官 Safra Catz 将离开华特迪士尼董事会
item.description: 华特迪士尼周五表示，甲骨文公司首席执行官萨弗拉-卡茨将在六年后离开这家娱乐公司的董事会。【原文：Walt Disney said on Friday that Oracle chief executive Safra Catz is departing the entertainment company's board after six years.】

item.title: 巴西航空工业公司第二季度交付量稳健增长，下半年业绩 "非常强劲"；股价上涨
item.description: 巴西飞机制造商巴西航空工业公司（Embraer）首席财务官安东尼奥-卡洛斯-加西亚（Antonio Carlos Garcia）周五表示，在达到2024年上半年的交付预期后，该公司正在为 "非常强劲 "的下半年做准备。【原文：Brazilian planemaker Embraer is gearing up for a "very strong" second half after meeting its expectations for deliveries in the first half of 2024, Chief Financial Officer Antonio Carlos Garcia said on Friday.】

item.title: 西班牙国家发展银行（BNDES）负责人表示，Gol 和 LATAM 正在就增加巴西航空工业公司的飞机进行深入谈判
item.description: 巴西国家开发银行（BNDES）负责人周五表示，Gol 和 LATAM 航空公司正在就为其机队增加巴西航空工业公司（Embraer）飞机一事进行深入谈判，巴西正敦促这两家公司从当地制造商处购买飞机。【原文：Gol and LATAM Airlines are in advanced talks to add Embraer aircraft to their fleets, the head of Brazil's state development bank BNDES said on Friday, as the country urges them to buy planes from the local manufacturer.】

item.title: 彭博社报道：美国联邦贸易委员会就欧佩克通讯问题对赫斯和西方石油公司高管进行调查
item.description: 据彭博新闻社周五报道，美国联邦贸易委员会正在调查赫斯公司（Hess corp）、西方石油公司（Occidental）和钻石能源公司（Diamondback Energy）等大型石油公司高管与欧佩克官员的沟通情况。【原文：The U.S. Federal Trade Commission is probing executives from major oil firms, including Hess corp , Occidental and Diamondback Energy over their communications with OPEC officials, Bloomberg News reported on Friday】

item.title: 美国联邦储备委员会因绿点公司的大量不公平和欺骗性行为对其罚款 4400 万美元
item.description: 美国联邦储备委员会周五宣布，对总部位于犹他州的绿点公司罚款 4400 万美元，原因是该公司采取了大量 "不公平和欺骗性 "做法，而且风险管理不力。【原文：The U.S. Federal Reserve announced on Friday it had fined Utah-based Green Dot $44 million for numerous "unfair and deceptive" practices, as well as deficient risk management.】

item.title: 工会称美国航空公司空乘人员与公司就新合同达成协议
item.description: 美国航空公司空乘人员工会周五表示，空乘人员已就新合同与公司达成协议。【原文：American Airlines flight attendants have reached a deal with the company over a new contract, their union said on Friday.】

item.title: 消息人士称，激进投资者埃利奥特持有大量星巴克股份
item.description: 一位消息人士周五告诉路透社，激进投资者埃利奥特投资管理公司（Elliott Investment Management）已持有星巴克相当大的股份。【原文：Activist investor Elliott Investment Management has built a sizeable stake in Starbucks , a source told Reuters on Friday.】

item.title: 巴西空中交通管制未受全球故障影响，但部分航班延误
item.description: 巴西政府周五表示，虽然出现了一些航班延误，但巴西的空中交通管制并未受到国际网络故障的影响，而其他公司也在处理国内的中断事件。【原文：Brazil's government said on Friday that its air traffic control was not impacted by an international cyber outage, although there were some flight delays, while other firms dealt with disruptions in the country.】

item.title: 全球技术故障后保险公司面临业务中断索赔
item.description: 保险业专家表示，周五一场全球性的技术故障导致从旅游到金融等行业陷入瘫痪，保险公司可能面临大量业务中断索赔。【原文：Insurers could face a raft of business interruption claims after a worldwide tech outage crippled industries from travel to finance on Friday, insurance industry experts said.】

item.title: 独家报道：克莱斯勒母公司斯泰兰特为美国燃油经济性罚款支付 1.907 亿美元
item.description: 路透社看到的政府文件显示，克莱斯勒母公司斯特兰蒂斯因未能满足美国 2019 年和 2020 年的燃油经济性要求而支付了 1.907 亿美元的民事罚款，另外还欠 4.597 亿美元的罚款未付。【原文：Chrysler parent Stellantis paid $190.7 million in civil penalties for failing to meet U.S. fuel economy requirements for 2019 and 2020, and owes another $459.7 million in outstanding penalties, government documents seen by Reuters show.】

item.title: 据 Business Insider 报道，由于全球 IT 故障，特斯拉部分生产线停产
item.description: 据 Business Insider 周五援引熟悉内情的消息人士的话报道，由于全球 IT 故障，特斯拉停止了部分生产线。【原文：Tesla halted some production lines due to the global IT outage, Business Insider reported on Friday, citing sources familiar with the matter.】

item.title: CrowdStrike 混乱可能促使投资者和客户反思
item.description: 美国网络安全公司 CrowdStrike 周五因错误的原因成为家喻户晓的名字，因为一次错误的更新在全球范围内造成了严重破坏。【原文：American cybersecurity company CrowdStrike became a household name for all the wrong reasons on Friday, after a botched update caused havoc around the world.】

item.title: 没有备份计划，全球 IT 故障将再次发生
item.description: 周五的全球 IT 故障导致飞机停飞，从银行业务到医疗保健服务都受到冲击，这种情况以前也发生过，除非在网络中建立更多的应急措施，组织机构制定更好的备份计划，否则这种情况还会发生。【原文：Elements of Friday’s global IT outage, which grounded planes and hit services from banking to healthcare, have occurred before and until more contingencies are built into networks, and organisations put better back-up plans in place, it will happen again.】

item.title: 纽约敦促银行和公司在全球技术故障中保持高度警惕
item.description: 纽约州监管机构周五敦促银行和公司在全球技术故障中保持高度警惕，表示正在监控机构和市场事件，并与其他州和联邦监管机构合作。【原文：New York state regulators urged banks and companies to be on high-alert amid the global tech outage on Friday, saying it is monitoring institutions and market events and working with other state and federal regulators.】

item.title: 巴菲特的 PacifiCorp 公司涉嫌与野火受害者的律师事务所串通一气
item.description: 就 2020 年劳动节周末俄勒冈州发生的野火，牵头对 PacifiCorp 提起集体诉讼的律师事务所希望调查沃伦-巴菲特（Warren Buffett）的伯克希尔-哈撒韦公司（Berkshire Hathaway）旗下的公用事业公司是否与其他律师事务所串通一气，与火灾受害者达成低价和解。【原文：The law firms leading class-action litigation against PacifiCorp over the 2020 Labor Day weekend wildfires in Oregon want to examine whether the utility owned by Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway is colluding with other law firms to reach lowball settlements with fire victims.】
